poem:
### Active Shadows

In silent gyms  
muscles strain, grow  
hearts beating in echo  
of whispered indoctrination—  
boys tighten fists,  
a mirror to each other,  
echoes of fear  
hurled quietly,  
beneath shared weight.  
We forge  
more than sculpted forms,  
mindful scars,  
as they push  
the heavy iron  
of tomorrow's disquiet.
